text: 30 years ago today, during her first 100 days as First Lady, Barbara Bush visited Grandma's House and hugged Donovan, a baby with AIDS. It's easy to forget what a powerful, unspoken statement this was at a time many worried about even being near a person with AIDS. #TheMatriarch
author: SusanPage

text: While the sample sizes get too small to be reliable, I'll just note that we found no clear gender gap among Democratic voters on this question. But GOP men were significantly more OK with a #2020 ticket of two white men than GOP women were.
author: SusanPage

text: Paging Mike Pence: I wasn't surprised that 44% of Dems in our new poll say they wouldn't be satisfied with a #2020 ticket of two white men. Was surprised that 31% of Republicans said that.
author: SusanPage

text: Well, in the interests of full disclosure, the author of the article, @BenLeubsdorf, just possibly could be my older son. : )
author: SusanPage

text: I can honestly say that this is the best article I have ever read in Library Quarterly.
author: SusanPage

text: Eyes on the prize: Democratic voters solidly back #MedicareForAll and the #GreenNewDeal. But by 55%-35%, they'd prefer a nominee who can win, even if they differ on issues, over a candidate "in line with my priorities, even if it is harder to win." New @USATODAY @Suffolk_U Poll
author: SusanPage

text: Why (college) journalism matters: "In additional emails sent between 2015 and 2018, reviewed by The Herald, the Advancement Office asked a faculty member to meet with three different prospective students, calling each “a trustee referral.”"
author: SusanPage

text: "In this week’s poll, Trump, Speaker Nancy Pelosi, the Democratic Party, and the Republican Party all had higher negatives than positives. For survey respondents, the third-party nominee is an outlet for disdain." Via @davidpaleologos
author: SusanPage

text: Heads-up: Posting a new @USATODAY @Suffolk_U Poll later this morning on the #2020 presidential race.
author: SusanPage

text: "The final tallies, 5-4 to uphold the individual mandate and 7-2 to curtail the Medicaid plan, came after weeks of negotiations and trade-offs among the justices." And more from @JoanBiskupic in her new bio of John Roberts, THE CHIEF.
author: SusanPage

text: Countdown: 12 days until the pub date for my new book, THE MATRIARCH. I had the last interview President Bush 41 did with a journalist, below. He still remembered what caught his eye at the country-club dance when he first spied Barbara Pierce.  She was 16 years old.
author: SusanPage

text: An interesting view on the value of the Electoral College —>>
author: SusanPage

text: Yes! I'll be at the Los Angeles Times Book Festival on Saturday April 13 to talk about #TheMatriarch. Would love to see you there. Thanks.
author: SusanPage

text: In Houston April 8? Excited to be signing copies of #TheMatriarch at @BlueWillowBooks, the famous and fabulous independent bookstore in Barbara Bush's hometown. Please come by, 5 PM.
author: SusanPage

text: The little-known romantic side of @cspan -->>
author: SusanPage

text: Must. Not. Smile.
author: SusanPage

text: An exclusive interview with @SpeakerPelosi by my @USATODAY colleague @elizacollins1 -->>
author: SusanPage

text: I'm pretty sure that first one is a rare photograph of Abraham Lincoln.
author: SusanPage

text: Barbara Bush's little dogs, Bibi and Mini Me, hated everyone except their mistress and, apparently, @greta Van Susteren. George Bush 41 gave Mini Me her name because he said the dog that was just a puff of white fur looked like his wife.  #TheMatriarch
author: SusanPage

text: Absolutely!
author: SusanPage

text: Oh. My.
author: SusanPage

text: Americans expressed outrage not only about illegal ways the rich have gamed getting into elite universities. By more than 3-1 in our new survey, they say college admissions generally favor the wealthy and well-connected in ways that are unfair to everybody else.
author: SusanPage

text: Spring!
author: SusanPage

text: When you hear the title she suggested, I think it will be clear she was being humorous, not serious. And while she didn't like the word "matriarch," she also didn't deny that it could apply to her. Thanks.
author: SusanPage

text: Please join us at @PoliticsProse bookstore on April 6 for a conversation about THE MATRIARCH with none other than Diane Rehm!
author: SusanPage

text: That'll cost you $32.50. : )
author: SusanPage

text: Countdown: Two weeks from today is the pub date for my new book. At the first of five interviews (shown below), Barbara Bush suggested the title for her biography, a funny idea I didn't use. Instead, I called it THE MATRIARCH, a word she in fact didn't like at all!
author: SusanPage

text: Not complaining, exactly, but decades of watching @lawandorder reruns apparently has given me an unrealistic picture of how fast things move in a courtroom. Much more than an hour has passed and we don’t yet have a dramatic verdict! Or even a seated jury!
author: SusanPage

text: Continuing her series of smart Supreme Court portraits, @JoanBiskupic has written what this reviewer calls an “assiduously reported and briskly written biography” of Chief Justice John Roberts.
author: SusanPage

text: Give that turkey a school crossing-guard sash.
author: SusanPage

text: The power of Pelosi: A remarkable 41% of Democrats in our new national @USATODAY @Suffolk_U Poll say @SpeakerPelosi’s comments about impeaching Trump have affected their own views on the issue, about equal to the 42% who say they didn’t have an impact.
author: SusanPage

text: In the Jury Lounge at the DC courthouse, a fellow member of the jury pool demands, unsuccessfully, that the group TV channel be changed so the “citizens of Washington” don’t have to listen to the racism being spewed by. . . @cspan. (Courthouse officialdom declines.)
author: SusanPage

text: Nancy Armour @nrarmour is the best! Although the 2019 Axthelm Lecture sounds pretty formidable, too.
author: SusanPage

text: Despite the positive findings for Trump in the survey, it shows a nation that remains skeptical of the president’s honesty and deeply divided by his leadership. 52%  say they have little or no trust in his denials that his 2016 campaign colluded with Moscow.
author: SusanPage

text: The poll's findings set the stage for a ferocious partisan battle when Mueller submits his report to AG William Barr, expected soon. The president's cascade of criticism of those pursuing him has succeeded in fortifying his support and raising questions about his investigators.
author: SusanPage

text: Heads up: New @USATODAY @Suffolk_U Poll out later this morning on attitudes toward President Trump, special counsel Robert Mueller and impeachment.
author: SusanPage

text: Happy birthday, @CarlPLeubsdorf!
author: SusanPage

text: This is easy to forget: As @ktumulty reminds, "C-SPAN is now such a ubiquitous presence in the capital that it is easy to forget how radical an idea it was." And how radically it has changed how voters can and do see our government.
author: SusanPage

text: Family foto at ⁦@MeetThePress⁩ — with ⁦@chucktodd⁩ ⁦@Yamiche⁩ ⁦@jdbalart⁩ ⁦@arthurbrooks⁩
author: SusanPage

text: 2/2 And here’s ⁦@chucktodd⁩! ⁦@MeetThePress⁩
author: SusanPage

text: Behind the scenes on ⁦@MeetThePress⁩ with ⁦@jdbalart⁩ ⁦@Yamiche⁩ and (remotely) ⁦@PatToomey⁩.
author: SusanPage

text: If you refer to yourself as a candidate, does that make you one? Biden told Delaware Democrats he has the "most progressive record of anybody running." Oops, not yet: He quickly said he meant to say "anybody who would run." Via my @USATODAY Network colleagues at @delawareonline
author: SusanPage

text: Like other large U.S. employers, Boeing spends millions of dollars each year on lobbying the administration and making campaign contributions. The company spent $15 million lobbying in 2018, more than household brands like Amazon and Facebook. By my colleagues @ganjansen @jfritze
author: SusanPage

text: Here is the story from the Daily Mail Australia about the heroism of Naeem Rashid, a Pakistani emigre who had moved to New Zealand to be a teacher:
author: SusanPage

text: Why don’t more GOP women run for office? At @WinningForWomen Roundtable, @joniernst acknowledges  unease with Trump and his rhetoric is one factor. “A lot of people don’t appreciate the way he speaks some of the time.” At Iowa town halls, voters urge her to “tell him to stop.”
author: SusanPage

text: Call him Senator Pompeo? The Secretary of State called Sen. @joniernst before heading to Iowa recently. She suggests to reporters that he still might run for senator from Kansas next year, despite denials: “It would be nice to have him back in Congress.”
author: SusanPage

text: Who’s on the line? @joniernst at @WinningForWomen roundtable with reporters says Trump called her cell phone last week, but she didn’t pick up the “Caller ID blocked” call until the White House left her a message telling her who it was.
author: SusanPage

text: Sen. @joniernst, who talked with President Trump last week about trade, says changes may be needed to push the new #NAFTA #USCMA through Congress. “It may take some changes,” she told reporters. “It would be tough to move it as it is.”
author: SusanPage

text: At ⁦@WinningForWomen⁩ Roundtable with reporters, Sen. @joniernst warns that Trump risks softening support in Iowa with trade troubles. “They’re still with the president,” she said of pork producers. “But if we don’t get the trade deals done, they could turn quickly.”
author: SusanPage
